docs.snippet: MURPHY--Sheila T.,died at her home on September 28th. She was born in Yorkville, NYC, graduated from Lawrence Academy, the College of New Rochelle and received a Masters in Education from New York University. She married her beloved Francis T. Mur...

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  MURPHY, SHEILA T.

docs.lead_paragraph: MURPHY--Sheila T.,died at her home on September 28th. She was born in Yorkville, NYC, graduated from Lawrence Academy, the College of New Rochelle and received a Masters in Education from New York University. She married her beloved Francis T. Murphy on July 4, 1959. She is survived by her husband and five children, Timothy and his wife, Pamela; Eileen and her husband, Jeffrey Forsyth; Kathleen and her husband, Lance Scott; Sheila and her husband, Michael Sproule; Annemarie and her husband, Kevin Casey; and her brother Thomas Casey. Loving grandmother to Casey, Kaitlyn, Tim, Matthew, Sean, Patrick, Michael, Brendan, Megan and Liam. A gracious lady with a generous heart, strong religious beliefs and a non-judgmental nature. Friends may call on October 2nd from 4:00 to 8:00pm at Graham Funeral Home, 1036 Boston Post Road, Rye, NY. Mass of Christian burial at 10:00am on October 3rd at Our Lady of Perpetual Help, 575 Fowler Avenue, Pelham Manor, NY. Interment at St. Raymond's Cemetery. In lieu of flowers, please send donations to Calvary Hospital Hospice, 1740 Eastchester Road, Bronx, NY 10461.

docs.snippet: HIRSCH--Bernard "Bud", 85, passed away peacefully on September 29, 2014. He worked as a television executive for both CBS and NBC from the '50s to the '90s, and, after retirement, traveled the world. He enjoyed travel, food, and his family. He wil...
docs.lead_paragraph: HIRSCH--Bernard "Bud", 85, passed away peacefully on September 29, 2014. He worked as a television executive for both CBS and NBC from the '50s to the '90s, and, after retirement, traveled the world. He enjoyed travel, food, and his family. He will be missed. He leaves behind his brother (Herbert), two sons (Peter and Richard), three daughters-in-law (Jill, Diane, Bridgette), five grandchildren (Katharine, David, Noah, Rebecca, Graham) and his loving wife Peggy. Services will be at Plaza Jewish Community Chapel, 630 Amsterdam Ave, 3:30pm on Sunday October 5th.

docs.snippet: GRIFFO--William Paul. Beloved son of Drs. Yvona and William Griffo and brother Michael ("BRO") passed suddenly and peacefully on September 25, 2014. Born on Saturday, May 18, 1996, he was currently a senior at Poly Prep Country Day School where he...

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  GRIFFO, WILLIAM PAUL

docs.lead_paragraph: GRIFFO--William Paul. Beloved son of Drs. Yvona and William Griffo and brother Michael ("BRO") passed suddenly and peacefully on September 25, 2014. Born on Saturday, May 18, 1996, he was currently a senior at Poly Prep Country Day School where he was a proud and loyal teammate on the varsity soccer, ice hockey and Lacrosse teams. In 2011, he graduated from St. David's School in New York City. William is survived by his beloved aunt, uncle and two cousins (Capitani family) in Staten Island, New York as well as a cousin, uncle and aunt (Kolar family in Prague, Czech Republic. His devoted sole surviving grandparent is Mary Ann Griffo. He was predeceased by maternal grandparents, Zdenka and Vladimir Kolar of Prague. William, this summer contributed community service at Marist Brothers Camp, an organization devoted to a dignified life for developmentally challenged adults. Contributing his humor, joy and talents as a counselor brought great happiness to William. In lieu of flowers, contributions to the Marist Brothers Center at Esopus Mid Hudson Valley Camps PO Box 197, Esopus, NY 12429 (esopuscamps.com). Visitation at Frank E Campbell 1076 Madison Ave (81st ST) on Thursday, October 2, 2014 from 7-9pm. Mass of Christian Burial at The Church of Saint Catherine of Siena, 411 East 68th Street, Friday 10am.

docs.snippet: DELAPINE--Maryellen "Mel," 64, of Estero, FL passed away on September 29, 2014. She is survived by her beloved husband, Tom; her daughter, Denise (George Leibel) and her son, Tommy (Angela). Mel was also the devoted and loving grandmother to Ali, ...
docs.lead_paragraph: DELAPINE--Maryellen "Mel," 64, of Estero, FL passed away on September 29, 2014. She is survived by her beloved husband, Tom; her daughter, Denise (George Leibel) and her son, Tommy (Angela). Mel was also the devoted and loving grandmother to Ali, Brooklin, Taylor and Thomas Delapine and Melissa Michalak. After being diagnosed with Breast Cancer in 1997 Mel became a fierce and tireless advocate for women's health, active on the Community Outreach Board of the Linda Creed Breast Cancer Foundation, Advisory Board of the Breast Cancer Center of Excellence at the University of Pennsylvania, Community Ambassador for the American Cancer Society, Field Coordinator of the National Breast Cancer Coalition, and a member of the Committee on Education of the Florida Breast Cancer Coalition. In 2010, she became a Lung Cancer Advocate for the Alliance for Clinical Trials in Oncology. Mel was also a grant reviewer for the Department of Defense Breast Cancer Research Program, Komen for the Cure, NYS Board of Health, State of California Breast Cancer Research Program, the LiveStrong Foundation, Cochrane Collaboration, American Cancer Society, Department of Defense Lung Cancer Research Program, and the Cancer Prevention Research Institute of Texas. Her infectious personality, devotion, selflessness and sense of humor will be sorely missed by everyone in her family as well all of her volunteer colleagues throughout the country. There will be a private family service. In lieu of flowers, the family requests that donations be made to the Linda Creed Breast Cancer Foundation, P.O. Box 40607 Philadelphia, PA 19107 (http://www.lindacreed.org). Please visit www.fullermetz.com to leave the family a condolence.

docs.snippet: CONNAUGHTON--Rev. Msgr. Lawrence M.,who was a priest of the Archdiocese of New York since his ordination in 1970 by then Archbishop Terrance Cardinal Cook at the Cathedral of St. Patrick, died September 29. He was appointed a Prelate of Honor of H...

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  CONNAUGHTON, REV. MSGR. LAWRENCE M.

docs.lead_paragraph: CONNAUGHTON--Rev. Msgr. Lawrence M.,who was a priest of the Archdiocese of New York since his ordination in 1970 by then Archbishop Terrance Cardinal Cook at the Cathedral of St. Patrick, died September 29. He was appointed a Prelate of Honor of His Holiness, Reverend Monsignor in August 1990 and at the time of his passing was pastor of St. John Nepomucene Church and administrator of St. John the Martyr Church in Manhattan, where he had served since 2012. He was 70. Born to the late Frank and Elizabeth Connaughton, in West Brighton, Staten Island, NY on April 24, 1944, he attended Sacred Heart Elementary School and St. Peter's High School before St. Joseph's Seminary in Yonkers, NY. For the next 44 years he served in a number of parishes throughout the Archdiocese and also held a number of administrative roles within the Archdiocese of New York during his priesthood. Most notably he was Dean of Students and Procurator to St. Joseph's Seminary (1983-1988), Vice Chancellor and Director of Priest's Personnel (1988-1990) and Executive Director of Development in the early 1990's. He was also a trustee of the Alfred E. Smith Memorial Foundation since 1990. He was predeceased by his sister Maura E. Mannion (Raymond P.) of Suffern, NY and is survived by his siblings John F. (Anne) of Trumbull, CT and Kathleen Cleary (Dennis) of Astoria Queens, NY along with nine nieces and nephews and eleven great nieces and nephews. The family will receive visitors at the Church of St. Joseph in the Yorkville neighborhood of Manhattan (404 East 87th St.) on Wednesday, October 1, 3pm 7pm. The Mass of Christian Burial will be celebrated on Thursday, October 2 at 10am at the Church of St. Joseph with burial to follow at St. Peter's Cemetery in Staten Island. In lieu of flowers, the family has requested that memorial gifts be made to Catholic Relief Services (crs.org) PO Box 17090, Baltimore, MD 21297-0303 or Catholic Near East Welfare Association (cnewa.org), 1011 1st Ave, New York, NY 10022-4195.

docs.snippet: CARTER--John Mack. The Board of Directors and staff of Susan G. Komen Greater NYC note with sadness the passing of John Mack Carter. John was the visionary co-founder of the Komen NYC Race for the Cure. His legacy endures in the continued success ...

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  CARTER, JOHN MACK

docs.lead_paragraph: CARTER--John Mack. The Board of Directors and staff of Susan G. Komen Greater NYC note with sadness the passing of John Mack Carter. John was the visionary co-founder of the Komen NYC Race for the Cure. His legacy endures in the continued success of the Race and the Greater NYC Affiliate of Susan G. Komen, today the largest of the Komen affiliates. We are indebted to his commitment to ending breast cancer.
